tiles.title: Single Page Applications
descriptions: Architected and led development of multiple production SPAs using TypeScript and Angular, serving 3.5 million+ users globally across education platforms.
Defined component-based design patterns and responsive layouts ensuring cross-browser and cross-platform compatibility on desktop, tablet, and mobile devices.
Established front-end architecture standards across multiple teams, driving adoption of TypeScript, component patterns, and design principles that prioritize usability.

images.description: The TI-84 Plus CE online calculator provides an emulator for the TI-84 Plus CE calculator.
images.alt: Screenshot of the landing page for the TI-84 Plus CE online calculator

images.description: The TI Nspire Connect web application provides users with the ability to send and receive files from their Nspire CX-II calculators as well as updating their calculator OS.
images.alt: Picture of a laptop showing nspire connect and connected over usb to a ti graphing calculator

tiles.title: License Activation Center
descriptions: Designed and implemented full-stack license activation portal with Angular frontend, RESTful middleware (Java/Spring Boot), and Oracle database backend.
Implemented OAuth single-sign-on authentication and third-party (10duke) entitlement validation, enabling seamless user onboarding for thousands of users.
Owned complete development lifecycle from requirements translation to production deployment, managing Scrum execution and cross-functional coordination.

images.description: License Activation Center allows users to configure and activate their purchased-or-otherwise-obtained product licenses
images.alt: Screenshot of TI's license activation center web app

tiles.title: Build System Optimization
descriptions: Reduced build times by 70% through Jenkins parallelization and gulp workflow optimization, dramatically improving developer productivity and CI/CD efficiency.
Developed gulp.js build scripts that seamlessly integrated disparate platform build tools (CMake, MSBuild), keeping deployment flexibility on the development team's side.
Actively managed task division across parallel gulp tasks to sustain peak performance and prevent bottlenecks.

images.description: Jenkins provides development teams with continuous integration tasks. This was used on various projects, including one where efficiencies were accomplished by using parallel builds with multiple nodes.
Gulp.js is a javascript task manager used for build scripts.
images.alt: gulp.js logo and sample code in an IDE

tiles.title: Calculator Emulators
descriptions: Built high-performance calculator emulators for the browser, implementing Z80, eZ80, Toshiba T4, and Lapis MCU architectures in pure JavaScript and TypeScript for maximum compatibility.

Architected the TI-84 Plus CE emulator as a reusable component integrated across multiple environments: Java web views, Electron, Chrome App, and standalone SPAs, requiring extensive performance optimization for constrained browsers.
Ported emulators used by millions of students in exam settings (ACT, SAT, AP exams) with zero reported issues during 800k+ user pilots on first release.

images.description: TI's ExamCalc set of products provides testing agencies with calculator emulators
images.alt: Screenshot of Texas Instruments' ExamCalc product page

images.description: At the time of this writing, Examcalcs provide emulators for one 4-function, 2 scientific and 3 graphing calculators
images.alt: Group of calculators provided by the examcalcs product line

tiles.title: WebAssembly & Cross-Compilation
descriptions: Led WebAssembly adoption for calculator platform, cross-compiling C/C++ code to run natively in the browser via Emscripten.
Adapted CUnit testing to be run as WebAssembly on Node.js in parallel with it's Windows executable to ensure cross-platform support during feature implementation.
Designed and implemented JavaScript/C glue layers that enabled seamless interop between web frontends and compiled embedded libraries.
Integrated WebUSB and WebSerial APIs, enabling direct browser-to-calculator communication without requiring native drivers or pluginsâ€”a critical feature for exam and educational deployments.

images.description: WebAssembly (abbreviated Wasm) is a binary instruction format for a stack-based virtual machine supported on most browsers and Node.js
Emscripten is a C/C++ compiler toolchain that allows compiling to WebAssembly

tiles.title: Device Communications
descriptions: Designed cross-platform USB communication architecture using abstraction layers and Java Native Interface (JNI), delivering compatibility across Windows and macOS in support of TI-Connect CE
Ported proprietary CARS communication protocol to generate platform-native libraries, enabling consistent behavior across desktop applications and web environments.
Implemented JavaScript glue code to enable the cross-compiled proprietary NavNet communications library to work via WebUSB

Implemented WebSocket-driven automation layer for browser-based calculator emulation, enabling seamless integration with test frameworks and allowing identical APIs between physical devices and emulated calculators.

images.description: TI-Connect CE is a desktop application that enables usb communications with TI Calculators, supporting file transfer, OS updates and screen capture capabilities.
images.alt: Screenshot of the TI-Connect CE desktop application

images.description: TI-Connect CE for Chrome OS is a chromeapp that enables usb communications with TI Calculators, supporting file transfer and screen capture capabilities.
images.alt: Screenshot of the TI-Connect CE for Chrome OS application

tiles.title: Screen Reader Support
descriptions: Implemented screen reader support across Z80 assembly and JavaScript layers, enabling vision-impaired students to interact with calculator emulators. Designed innovative notification mechanism where calculator assembly code generates accessibility events that JavaScript interprets as aria-live announcements, solving a unique challenge in emulator accessibility.
Extended accessibility to scientific calculators by implementing OCR algorithms to translate screen contents into voiceable text for screen readers.

images.description: In an iteration of the TI-84 Plus CE code was added to enable changes in the calculator's state to be announced by screen reader software.
images.alt: Picture of a TI-84 Plus CE calculator

tiles.title: User Experience & Responsiveness
descriptions: Partnered closely with product management and UX designers to translate complex technical constraints into intuitive, user-centric interfaces.
Designed responsive layouts specifically optimized for Chromebooks and tablets, ensuring usable experiences across diverse device types and screen sizes.
Implemented UI features like screen capture, file transfer, and graph animation to enhance educational value and user engagement.

images.description: Npsire Connect is one of the examples where the UX was simplified to allow for guided workflows
images.alt: Picture of a laptop showing nspire connect and connected over usb to a ti graphing calculator

tiles.title: Code Quality & Standards
descriptions: Established mandatory code review culture across multiple teams, raising quality standards through consistent application of testing frameworks (Mocha/Chai/Jasmine/Jest) and static analysis tools.
Designed and met code quality metrics using unit tests, code sanitizers, linters, and static analyzers, ensuring maintainability and reducing technical debt.
Implemented automated testing infrastructure including WebSocket-driven harness for Robot Framework and Python test reuse, enabling cross-team testing efficiency.

tiles.title: Mentorship & Team Growth
descriptions: Mentored junior and mid-level engineers through code reviews, technical deep-dives, and hands-on guidance, fostering skill development and team morale.
Led development teams in both technical and organizational roles (Development Lead, Scrum Master), coordinating cross-functional alignment between QA, product, and project management.
Built strong working relationships with QA, product, and project teams, establishing clear communication channels that enabled faster problem-solving and predictable feature delivery.

tiles.title: Innovation & Risk Mitigation
descriptions: Accelerated technology adoption by delivering rapid prototypes demonstrating feasibility of emerging tech (WebAssembly, WebUSB, WebSerial), de-risking technical decisions before full team commitment.
Coordinated business-wide Tech Sync sessions sharing technical knowledge across organization, improving collective understanding of deep technical topics.

Recognized as go-to technical expert for bridging low-level hardware emulation and proprietary communication protocols to modern web platforms, resulting in appointment to Texas Instruments' Technical Ladder.

tiles.title: iPhone Game Development
descriptions: Led development of first successful iPhone game prototype for Gameloft (Blockbreaker), establishing the studio's mobile game development capability and leading to expanded project assignments.
Ported game title from DirectX to iPhone's OpenGL ES, translating desktop game mechanics to touch and accelerometer input, including awarded title 'Circulate' (Bronze Medal, PocketGamer).
Optimized graphics pipelines and reduced polygon counts to maintain 60 FPS performance on resource-limited mobile devices while preserving visual fidelity.

images.description: Circulate was a game orignally made for PC that was ported in 2 versions to iPhone, a prologue version that was limited to a single level with no obstacles and a full version that included multiple levels
images.alt: Screenshot of the circulate proplogue iphone game

tiles.title: Cross-Platform Mobile Porting
descriptions: Led technical efforts porting game titles to resource-constrained carrier devices using Java/J2ME and OpenGL ES, requiring strategic scope reduction and micro-optimizations.
Managed Virgin Mobile team responsible for space-constrained device deployments, coordinating asset compression and performance tuning to fit strict memory budgets.
Created in-app purchase client module for Qualcomm's Brew framework (C/C++), enabling monetization across multiple game titles and reducing code duplication.

images.description: The Kyocera K10 was one of the most resource-limited devices in Virgin Mobile's catalog.

tiles.title: Licensing & Compliance
descriptions: Responsible for reviewing third-party library eligibility and managing open source licensing across product releases, ensuring EULA compliance and reducing legal risk.
Led IT security remediation efforts, coordinating team to address security scan concerns including HTTP header modifications and HTML meta tag additions across web applications.
Maintained responsibility for release-cycle open source auditing, protecting company and customers from licensing conflicts.
